results.title: Where Mrs. Whalley lives
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Howe and Graham Parker
results.brief_description: A study of the conflict between generations that can arise despite the best efforts of everyone to avoid it. Mrs. Whalley is an aging grandmother who lives with her son’s family, and sometimes it becomes a strain to hide hurt and loneliness for the sake of harmony in her son’s home. Cast includes Maude Whitmore, Leslie Yeo, Doug Chamberlin, Jean Caval.

results.title: Where mountains float: A Greenland story
results.creator_credit: Arno Studio, Government Film Committee of Denmark and Bjarne Henning-Jensen
results.brief_description: Through events in the life of 10 year-old Mikisoq, an eskimo boy living with his family in a remote Greenland settlement, we see how a new Greenland is emerging with the involvement of Denmark. The heavy decrease in seal catches imposes poverty and hardship and the film shows how Mikisoq and his family eventually find a different life and future in a southern town. Grandfather prefers to stay behind.

results.title: Where Jesus Walked
results.brief_description: Travel the world of Jesus Christ and walk in the footsteps of the Messiah. Capture the beauty of the Holy Land, yesterday and today, on film never before seen. Follow the paths of Jesus’ travels, from Bethlehem to Nazareth, Jerusalem and Calvary to the Sea of Galilee, Copernicum and Jericho. Beautifully photographed with scriptural narrative and original music.

results.title: Where is dead?
results.creator_credit: Lifestyle Productions and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
A low-keyed drama which deals compassionately with a subject that children sometimes have to face, the death of someone they love. When six-year-old Sarah’s older brother dies suddenly, her parents must explain to her what has happened and help her cope with her feelings.
Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Where have all the farms gone?
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Michael Brun
results.brief_description: Tumbledown, weatherbeaten old barns and dwellings stand like gaunt skeletons of other times, reproachful of an economy that let them down. Unable to compete with food-chain marketing, the farmers have moved into town, and eventually the bulldozer applies the final indignity to buildings that once represented a full and wholesome way of life. Filmed in 1969 in the Upper Ottawa Valley of Ontario and Quebec, this film carries nostalgia in its mute question: What price progress?

results.title: Where have all the drivers gone? [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Tarrif Insurance Companies and Eric L. Morris
results.brief_description: A road safety film which stresses that most accidents are caused by careless and inattentive drivers, or by mixing drinking with driving. Graphic scenes of the resulting tragedies - maiming or death - should convince drivers to concentrate on driving or they may discover that the answer to “Where have all the drivers gone?” is “Gone to graveyards every one”! Narrated by Jim Berinson.
